box.text: Encounter Goals Players receive experience points for overcoming obstacles that stand in the way of achieving the goals of the adventure. Feel free, however, to adjust the experience awards depending on how easily the players achieve an encounter goal.

item.text: Every encounter is rated with a Battle Value (BV), thatgeneral, an encounter with a Battle Value around the same as the characters is moderately challenging; difficult or dangerous enough to make the characters pay attention, but probably not life threatening if they're reasonably careful. A Battle Value of two to three times higher than the characters is a much more dangerous. On the other hand, minor encounters throughout the adventure might have a BV of two to three times lower than the characters. In addition to indicating challenge level, the BV is also used to determine the amount of experience characters get for succeeding in those encounters.
Determining the level of an encounter involves four steps:overall Battle Value from those individual BVs; considering the threat level of the encounter; and considering the encounter circumstances.

item.text: A hostile environment is an environment that does not promotean actively hostile hazards such as land mines. An example of a slightly hostile environment would be fighting out on populated city streets. A moderately hostile environment would be fighting in a densely populated mall. An example of a severely hostile environment would be fighting in the middle of a sandstorm. An example of an extremely hostile environment would be fighting in the middle of an active warzone.
